hints_html: Show that if \(\{a_n\}\) is a sequence converging to zero and M is a constant then the sequence \(\{Ma_n\}\) also converges to zero.
hints_latex:
Show that if $\{a_n\}$ is a sequence converging to zero and \emph{M} is
a constant then the sequence $\{Ma_n\}$ also converges to zero.
hints_raw: Show that if <math> \{a_n\} </math> is a sequence converging to zero and ''M'' is a constant then the sequence  <math> \{Ma_n\} </math> also converges to zero.
sols_html:
Since \(f\) is bounded there exists a constant M such that

\[\begin{aligned} |f(n)|<M \quad\text{for all } n\in \mathbb{N}\end{aligned}\]

We will show that \(\{f(n)a_n\}\) converges to zero. Let \(\epsilon>0\). Since \(\{a_n\}\) converges to zero there exists a positive integer N\(\varepsilon\) such that

\[\begin{aligned} |a_n|<\frac{\epsilon}{M} \quad\text{for all } n>N_\epsilon\end{aligned}\]

Hence

\[\begin{aligned} |f(n)a_n|=|f(n)||a_n|<M\frac{\epsilon}{M}=\epsilon \quad\text{for all } n>N_\epsilon\end{aligned}\]

This shows that \(\{f(n)a_n\}\) converges to zero.

statement_html:
Suppose that

\[\begin{aligned} f: \mathbb{N} \to \mathbb{R}\end{aligned}\]

is a bounded function and that \(\{a_n\}\) is a sequence that converges to 0. Prove that

\[\begin{aligned} \lim_{n \to \infty} f(n)a_n = 0\end{aligned}\]
